definition: to leap up/(coll.) to gush out/to spurt out
to ascend/to rise to the rank of/to promote/to hoist/liter/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth dou 斗[dou3]
variant of 升[sheng1]/to ascend/to rise in rank

sentences.english: Yet sales at film festivals this year have been brisk.
sentences.chinese: 然而，在今年的电影节上，独立电影销量又一度蹿升。

sentences.english: Navistar's shares surged 41% in a single day on the news.
sentences.chinese: 这条消息让航星在一天内蹿升了41%。

definition: to leap to (a higher position etc)/to jump/(of a plane) to ascend
to clamber up/(of prices etc) to rise
to skyrocket/to get quick promotion in one's career
(of water) to soar/(of prices) to skyrocket
to become suddenly popular/suddenly all the rage
to advance boldly/to push ahead vigorously
to rise/to ascend/to climb (airplane etc)/to go up (sales figures etc)/to gain promotion
